review_body: They lie to you I have never had any problems with this company/app but today really changed all of that. I wanted to add money to my account to cover some charges so I transferred almost $90 from my bank account to my Venmo account. If you have used this app before you know when you make a payment to someone the money comes out of your bank the next day. I checked my bank account and it came out so I check Venmo and it doesn‚Äôt show up. I talk to customer service on the chat, over email, and on the phone. Over chat and email they tell me it is run as an ACH transfer and takes 3-5 business days to show in my account. I work in a bank with these types of transfers and they never and I mean NEVER take 3-5 days. They take one at the most two days. Furthermore it was not run as an ACH transfer it was run as an auto debit (as if I swiped my debit card). I asked multiple times why I was being lied to and no answers just a run around. The girl at customer service on the phone was really trying to help me but she just didn‚Äôt have any information. I don‚Äôt know if she was new or if they just don‚Äôt care enough about their customers and employees to give them info and training to be able to help people.

wish I could give zero stars I have money that was sent to me for bills on my Venmo and when I tried sending it to my bank it immediately locked me out and said my account is frozen... I‚Äôm not sure why but it won‚Äôt even let me do anything from this point in my account. I went online to your ‚Äúhelp‚Äù page and followed the instructions for a frozen account... it ended up being a dead end. I then called customer support and they wouldn‚Äôt even tell me the issue with my account, just said it‚Äôs going to take 5-7 business days for an ‚Äúaccount specialist‚Äù to look into my account. I don‚Äôt mind that, all I asked was if I could send that money back to the original sender or just cancel that payment. They said once a payment is sent through there‚Äôs no way to get it back to the sender, not even through customer support. So basically I have money sitting in my account and I can‚Äôt even touch it because my account is frozen? And they won‚Äôt allow me to speak with anyone before the seven business days. Absolutely shocked and mortified with this apps customer service skills. Very obvious that they don‚Äôt care about their customers experience and they have zero safeguards for protecting the financial aspect of this app. There should be some way to send that money back to the sender so I‚Äôm not sitting here waiting for nearly two weeks just to access those funds, or allow me to speak to an account specialist over the phone. Once this situation is handled I‚Äôm never using this app ever again.

Private Commerce Public Benefit The creation of Venmo with its rapid success and broad public acceptance of the ubiquitous private wire transfer-like service, has affected the way we pay our rent, paid our friends for our share of a group vacation, bailed out our college student son when he had unexpected party costs at his fraternity, and there are now myriad other examples of private commerce being conducted constantly between the people of this fair city. But are the exchanges on Venmo more than a mere convenience? I believe that the legitimacy and subsequent public trust of doing business through Venmo has benefited our society in the most positive way by providing a legitimate and convenient way to pay or be paid by anyone with a bank account and internet access. The widely accepted nature of the effect Venmo has had, increasing the ability for people to pay and receive debts and the perhaps unintended consequences have been that Venmo helps the economic conditions of the places it is used, putting money in people‚Äôs pockets in a fast convenient way and with Venmo, gone are many excuses for why a debt cannot be paid, which will be the greatest benefit to our economic life that Venmo has provided. This private sector venture is creating public sector benefits and for that I am grateful.

Venmo is a horrible company There are so many issues with Venmo it‚Äôs completely ridiculous. Their app is a complete joke. Every transaction I‚Äôve ever done has had issues. Basically you get a generic error that says it‚Äôs your bank that‚Äôs the problem and that they are rejecting the payment. Which is completely untrue. That happens like 20 times and then randomly on that 21st time it goes through an hour or two later. The customer service is the worst I‚Äôve ever seen. They deactivate accounts without giving a reason or even attempting to contact the account holder first. They just deactivate the account and say we are not going to give you a reason (claiming that this is to protect their other users because knowing why is somehow a security risk). They don‚Äôt even let you respond. ‚ÄúIf you have any questions on this decision, this matter is closed and we can‚Äôt help you‚Äù. All the funds in the account they put under hold and you will likely never see them again. They are basically a bunch of thieves taking money from good people who made valid transactions that they deem invalid for their own made up reasons that they don‚Äôt want to share. When they see an opportunity, they cash in. I could keep going on with their bad business practices but my advice to anyone is just stay away. I personally wish I had never used their service, if you can use something else. Unless of course you like throwing your money in the trash or burning it.
Venmo card has been nothing but grief As far as transferring money to another person the service works pretty well , just like CashApp or PayPal.

Frustrated and Disappointed üëé I have had three venmo accounts and all of them had been shut down without any explanation. I use this app as a method of payment for my car cleaning services and without a doubt, each one gets shut down without hesitation in a matter of a couple of weeks, very frustrating. Venmo makes no effort to provide me with a reasonable explanation as to why ALL of my accounts have been shut down other than claiming it was their decision and I can no longer use their services.

Venmo is LITERALLY the worst!!! When I first started using Venmo a year ago, I had zero problems. Friends and family would send me money and I would use ‚Äúinstant transfer‚Äù to my bank account since that was the quickest way to send money and I would receive it with NO ISSUES! All of sudden I am getting problems with the instant transfer. I have contacted Venmo myself and let them know the situation thinking they could fix the problem since it‚Äôs on them, but they are just useless and they offered me a ‚Äúbetter solution‚Äù to the problem which was waiting 2-3 business days for the money to be sended to my bank account. HAHAHA NO. So apparently now their system is ‚Äúdeclining‚Äù my instant transfer funds and there is nothing they can do about it. How could you not do something about this!? It‚Äôs your company declining my transfer! If anything YOU SHOULD BE THE ONE TO FIX THIS. All I am trying to do send MY MONEY that I need to in my bank account, and yet I can‚Äôt touch it. This is absolutely ridiculous. This isn‚Äôt the first time this has happened to me with the instant transfer fund, but now that this is happened to me a second time, I am done. After I figure out a way to get all the money onto my bank account, I am deactivating Venmo. I will never use Venmo again. If you read this, please don‚Äôt waste your time on Venmo, because like they told me, there is nothing they can do about it. I am extremely disappointed and upset. Goodbye Venmo. üëéüèº

Was best cash app until I had a problem with my ATM withdrawal. Not having any transactions for over 24 hours, when I went to the ATM it declined me even though there was more than enough money in there. Thinking it will be a simple fix ended up being a 24 hour headache with still no resolution, And my money on able to be withdrawn or even used for purchases. Went from the best app to the worst app in one day! The funny part of all this headache, every time I called they said there is no holds or locks on your account everything looks fine. Something you must‚Äôve done at the ATM cause the computer to decline it. They couldn‚Äôt clear anything in the system and the best suggestion was wait a few hours and try again. After trying again and again, and calling them again and again. I was still on able to withdraw from the ATM. They don‚Äôt know why I was being blocked and said there is no hold on my account. I said to them if I can‚Äôt withdraw from an ATM I guess there‚Äôs no point of me having the Venmo account and I should just cancel it. Their response was yes I agree that would probably make sense if you‚Äôre an able to use it. Never in my life have I heard a company tell you to cancel them.  And that was from not only 1, but 2 people. 1 of them being a manager. And the crazy part of it all is still no one can override the computer that‚Äôs blocking me from using my ATM card.  So needless to say I‚Äôm done with Venmo

Convenient but still frustrating Venmo is a convenient money sharing app since it‚Äôs the one most people use but man oh man does it have some serious hang ups. It automatically shares your transaction history with all of your friends. It pulls these friends from Facebook and your phone and makes that list public as well. So anyone of those people can see everyone you know and who you‚Äôre paying for what.

Trash Venmo is literally one of the worst apps you could possibly get. I tried to send money to my account instantly and it wouldn‚Äôt go through. The excuse I was given was because of ‚Äúsuspicious activity‚Äù. Basically whatever they deem ‚Äúsuspicious‚Äù is grounds for your account to be frozen, delayed, and or locked completely. Pretty much any large sum of money is apparently ‚Äúsuspicious‚Äù so I wasn‚Äôt able to get my money out even after I said oh well I‚Äôll just do the standard transfer and wait the 1-3 business days. I had to send the money to a friend and have him do it instantly and send me the money on cash app. I‚Äôd honestly advise using cash app over Venmo easily. It‚Äôs simple, easy, and doesn‚Äôt have so much baggage with it. You just type the amount you want and you can send the money to someone instantly and take that money out whenever you want to. Customer service was awful and they didn‚Äôt believe the account actually belonged to me and had me go through at least 4 different security processes on the phone to make sure it was actually my account even though I explained in detail only things an account holder would know about their own specific account. They tried to make it way too complicated to use and it‚Äôs honestly a hassle anytime you actually want to use the app. I deleted it so fast after getting my money out and I‚Äôm never using it again

Much easier to use than writing a paper check. Very easy to use money transferred instantly. Much easier than writing a traditional check. I believe Venmo is also PayPal. I took away one star due to privacy. When you sign up it automatically uploads all of your contacts in your phone without warning. It also connects to social media like Facebook. Once you've registered you can change these privacy settings, so be aware to go to settings immediately if you don't want all of your contacts who use Venmo to see your transactions.  Also for each transaction you can select if you'd like your friends, the public to see Who you've paid, minus the amount. You can also set each transaction to private. Personally, I don't understand why it's anyone else's business who you pay for what kind of service. It's a Bizzarre concept to me, but then I don't live my life through social media. I am only using Venmo as a form of payment, like cleaning services. Still, it's easy to use and convenient. Just make sure to check Settings before you start transactions unless you want all of your friends, Family and coworkers to know what you're up to.

Really handy -  a few issues I use this app a ton and im a huge fan.   One thing that enraged me though is that they‚Äôll sometimes keep your money hostage when you try to pay someone , adding in layers of verification requirements while possibly collecting interest on the sums held up-  they don't notify the sender that the money they sent was unclaimed allowing the sender to choose an alternative payment channel -  I learned from a young homeless woman who had a Venmo account who i sent money to for train fare, that they would not allow her to accept what I sent.   I consider this to be abusive of their fiduciary role.  I want them to fix this and make it easier for people in her situation to access funds to be able to improve their situation or make it clear to the person who sends money that the money never reaches the intended recipient.  I would give them fewer stars for this issue, but i find for regular use with established contacts it works well.  I wish i had the option to preschedule payments or set regular payments.  I also wish that my venmo balance would apply to my payment when the amount exceeds the balance-  instead of sitting there!

Venmo Original I was a Venmo original user, telling all my friends this is the future of payments. I started saying ‚Äúhey guys Venmo me, oh you don‚Äôt have Venmo? What‚Äôs wrong with you? Don‚Äôt you know about Venmo? We don‚Äôt need cash to split bills anymore.‚Äù We‚Äôll, this was also in a period when Venmo said they would pay users if they invited their friends and they signed up. Until this day, I still get users that sign up, because of me, but Venmo does not pay me like they said they would. While I love their application, I don‚Äôt appreciate that they didn‚Äôt pay me for getting many of my friends, contacts, and business colleagues on Venmo. Maybe thousands of users but Venmo only paid me for the first few users. Venmo is great, but they owe me. I was inline with the thinking that there must be a better way to pay people, and I found Venmo, which was a simpler way to pay people than PayPal, which many people did not trust at the time. I convinced people that it would be safe and efficient. Venmo owes me for all the people I invited, as they said I would be reimbursed. Great app overall, just pay me. :)

Absolutely ridiculous! My friend transferred $400 to my account I go to do an instant transfer to my personal checking account and it will not go through. And oh how convenient no customer service support to call because apparently they work bankers hours. How in the world are you going to be a 24/7 cash application and not have any sort of online tech support or offer any live tech-support?? This is literally an emergency situation where I needed to borrow the funds which I did.....I now have my funds sitting in this stupid account which I am unable to touch or have access to and will have no way to contact their customer service until Monday morning it is currently Friday 7:30 PM. I am beyond furious. I knew I should‚Äôve gone with my gut and used the other three different cash apps I have on my phone which worked beautifully and have never had an issue with. I only last minute decided to use this one for the first time tonight never thinking for a second that I would not be able to access my funds. USER BEWARE PLEASE don‚Äôt use this stupid application....no tech-support after 4 PM M-F.

Disappointed and frustrated Had a friend want to send me money but they only use Venmo so I decided to download and set it up everything went great setting it up including the bank account until it came time to add my debit card for payments and instant transfers. It wouldn‚Äôt allow me to add my bank debit card or my credit card. I called my bank and they said they work with Venmo and my card should be working no problem. So I tried to contact Venmo today and they are closed to phone calls so I couldn‚Äôt talk to a person I could only email and or chat (txt) with them and they told me it was flagged and could not be added and that they couldn‚Äôt tell me why and said they weren‚Äôt provided that information and it was done by there automated system and there was no explanation they could give me and there was nothing they could do about it. I asked who would be able to give me that information and then they said there is no information available.. now I have to wait and transfer to my bank account in hopes they don‚Äôt try to flag that and hold my money. It‚Äôs not $20 bucks I‚Äôm trying to get out of my Venmo account either. If Venmo will correct my issues or even atleast give me an explanation I‚Äôd be happy to update my review but as of now I unfortunately have left this type of review.

They really froze my account and trying to hold my money Okay hello my name is johniqua so it says that Venmo is holding my money okay after my money is returned I‚Äôm not using Venmo again. I understand I violated some kind of rule or whatever. I clearly explained what happened plenty of times 4 times in a row sent my ny stat Id picture twice. I don‚Äôt get it I couldn‚Äôt put the money on my card I clearly explained that then it says I can‚Äôt use my account how in the world is it that sending money is so difficult. when you try to get your hard earned money back to you. which your the rightful owner of someone tells you they‚Äôre gonna hold it oh heck no. I will like my money returned to me no one has to ever worry about me using this app again. I‚Äôm sure I will never use this app. I will be darned if someone freezes my account then I give my Id and tells me they‚Äôre holding on to my money as if I‚Äôm a little kid who just got there allowance and is spending to much money I understand not you fault I chose this app and have to deal with whatever but if I knew I was causing trouble sending the money back to my boyfriend and requesting it back because we both couldn‚Äôt find a card to place the money on I would‚Äôve been asked my sister to use her bank card to put my money on man why the heck why do I have to go through this so I really can‚Äôt get my money back

Payment problems I have money in my venmo account and it‚Äôs not allowing me to pay someone with the money in my account it only allows me to pay with my debit card but I can‚Äôt pay with my debit card if my money is in my Venmo this app has serious problems that need to be addressed. Your instant transfer system needs to be fixed I talked to a support person and they told me that somedays you can instant transfer and some days you can‚Äôt this is upsetting and brings me to the conclusion that I will not be using this app. I can‚Äôt give the app no starts but if I could I would considering that your app isn‚Äôt compatible with my bank so I have to manually verify my bank which takes 3 days and then the standard transfer takes up to 3 more days so I cant get my money for a whole week like that is an issue. If I can instant transfer yesterday I should be able to today especially if there wasn‚Äôt no suspicious activity or anything of that matter on the card or account. Once I get my money I will not be using this app and I will advise all the people I know that have it to use a different app that actually gets you the money when you need it, I‚Äôm also never going to advise people to use the app or download it because of these problems you are hold peoples money and causing problems for them. I would fix your problems before your app falls under.

Transferred Money That I Couldn‚Äôt Even Use And Now My Money Is Being Held! I got my school refund on my chime account. I had a new card ordered and had not gotten it yet. And I needed the money, so I sent it to my brothers chime account. He then sent it to my Venmo account because I had that card. ALL of my transactions were getting declined, except a couple that went through. So I sent the money back to my brother, and ask him to try the transactions and to try to withdrawal from his Venmo. Same problem. So we contacted their chat team about it and we had recently moved so we figured it was happening because we moved to a different state. We called about it a couple times. And they ended up freezing our accounts! They asked us to send pictures of our State IDs or Drivers licenses to prove our identity. We did that. I also sent the a picture of our lease to update our new address. They told me that I went against their user agreement and that my account was being permanently closed and that they were investigating my money for up to 180 days to see if they can give me MY money back! I sent them pictures of my accounts showing what I did. And I also kept the chat transcripts and email communications with the company. No luck at all. And they won‚Äôt tell me how I violated the user agreement! I need my money! I have kids and bills to pay and I can‚Äôt now.

Cash app is overwhelmingly superior. I‚Äôve only had one transaction over Venmo and it‚Äôs already proved unusable. I was sent money by a friend on Venmo, against my raised objections. I already use Cash app, Zelle, PayPal frequently, but they sent it via Venmo anyway. I go to transfer the money to my bank account, and I get a vague error message. I successfully connected my bank account, but when I went to send the money, I got a vague error message. So I contact support through chat. I‚Äôm 34th in line to speak to a representative. After waiting 15 minutes, the chat window closes on its own. I reopen it, but have to get in the back of the line. I try again the next day. Same thing. A week later, I try again and get connected with a representative. I explained the situation, and the response was literally ‚Äúthe system is showing an arbitrary error for reasons that we representatives are not allowed to see on our end.‚Äù That‚Äôs right, the system had an error for reasons not shared with customer service reps. After some back and forth, the representative figures out that the error is because my bank info is on another Venmo account- my wife‚Äôs. Apparently Venmo does not allow a bank account number to be on more than one account. So, my wife and I can‚Äôt use the app at the same time. It‚Äôs just ridiculous.

Shady Hidden Fee They deducted $5 from one of my transactions because they told me I was in a $5 dollar deficit from a transaction that took place over a year ago. I was never given a notification nor an email saying that the payment method didn‚Äôt go through and I owed Venmo $5. My Venmo wallet even said I was at $0.00. Not ‚Äú-$5.00‚Äù. So they waited until I made a transaction and I noticed it was $5 short. The only thing they told me was a transaction I made a year ago with a specific account didn‚Äôt work, my bank couldn‚Äôt provide a routing number or account number for that account they said I used. That account in question HAS NOT BEEN AN ACTIVE BANK ACCOUNT SINCE 2016. So of course it‚Äôs not going to be a usable account. Which begs the question, why would I use that account to make a payment and why was it not declined from the very beginning? I even tested it by transferring $1 from that account to my friend, and it immediately declined it like it should have. All I‚Äôm saying is Venmo and PayPal have some very shady ways in collecting revenue from their customers via hidden fees. They basically gave me the run around about it. I wouldn‚Äôt be so disgruntled if I was given a heads up prior to the transaction that I was in a $5 deficit to them. But there was no notification and my Venmo wallet said I was squared at $0.00.

Instant transfer fails! When I first downloaded and added the app I didn't have any problems. So I had my family download the app too. Then all of a sudden my instant transfer option was not working. The only option that would work is the standard 3 business day option. I called my bank and they said it wasn't them because Venmo didn't even attempt the transfer. When I contacted Venmo they had no idea why it was happening, they actually said that! Then they said that it does happen at random and I was the lucky one! Then they told me the only way I could transfer to my bank was by using the standard 3 day option. This is ridiculous! I only downloaded this app because of the instant transfer option.

They Share Private Info. So I got a new phone and as such, ended up locked out of my Venmo account. I reached out with my email address on file, confirmed my private bank information, and after two weeks I cannot get any response to be let in to my account. They‚Äôre saying they need an image of my ID without any information covered as if the verification I provided already isn‚Äôt enough, but I am a victim of domestic violence and as such, requested written confirmation that an image of my ID would not ever be shared with anyone else before I provide it. THEY REFUSE TO GIVE IT TO ME. They will NOT put in writing that if my ex, who I named specifically, reached out for info about my account, they would not provide it - why won‚Äôt they agree not to give my personal information out to anyone else? This is SO scary, SO troubling, and enough for me to take my business elsewhere which is such a shame as I was considering migrating over to them entirely. I have followed up with them again in hopes to regain access to my account and once I do, will be pulling all my information and money out of it and requesting to be wiped from their database. I would never recommend Venmo to anyone and I will be taking this information anywhere I can so others are aware of how dangerous it is to trust Venmo with their private information.

It‚Äôs my money and I want it NOW!! Really!? 2-3 business Days just to transfer your money from your Venmo account to your bank or debit card? That blows. I suggest everyone try the Zelle app as soon as someone sends me money through Zelle I get a text from both Zelle that someone transferred me money and I also get a notification from my bank telling me they processed a check for the amount I just reviewed on Zelle. So I don‚Äôt even have to go into the Zelle app and say transfer to my bank, IT DOES IT FOR ME! So nice and convenient. I have nothing to do with the Zelle app I am just impatient and want my money that someone sends me right away and to have it accessible and ready to spend using my own debit card from my own bank instead of having to get a Venmo card just one more card to carry around in my wallet. I don‚Äôt use Venmo to make purchases or pay friends back for pizza or anything I use it to just collect money for my businesses and the services we provide. So again it‚Äôs my money and I want it now, I don‚Äôt want to have to wait 2-3 days for it to get into my own personal bank account or be charged a fee to do it right away like other apps do like the CashApp. That‚Äôs just absurd take a percentage of my money Bc I want it now!!! Again Zelle is where it‚Äôs at, it‚Äôs the beezkneez!

Glad to have! Had friends tell me to get this multiple times but never wanted it or needed it until recently I needed this for an important purpose to receive some money so I finally gave in and downloaded VENMO, and I‚Äôm so glad that I did.  Taking a bit to learn and maneuver but I will get there.  One downside I don‚Äôt like and that‚Äôs aggravating me (although I have set mine to private) is that when I open the app I see people‚Äôs business (people I know of that I don‚Äôt care to be reminded of and folks I don‚Äôt know transactions of sorts, and I find that so very annoying).   I still give 5 stars even with the annoyances bc I‚Äôm hopeful that with the right setting I can get rid of all that extra junk I see about other folks bc I only care what my personal business is doing, not theirs.  Great app. overall that I can tell. Going to be very handy at times for me.  Another awesome thing that much use is free and certain usage is very reasonable fee(s) so that makes it much, much better.  Thanks VENMO!

Venmo is unacceptable ! I am very disappointed in venmo and will probably never use it again. I understand you guys freeze accounts when you suspect something but the process to unfreeze takes way to long. I have $190 in my frozen account & I need this money to help support my household in this corona situation but I am still under review after 2-3 days of sending my iD in. Cashapp instantly makes you take a picture within the app of you iD and you are back to using your money. It makes me very upset that I have to go through this not only do I have to ask people for money but pay them back when my account unfreezes. I DONT KNOW WHEN MY ACCOUNT IS GOING TO UNFREEZE. Yes I already sent my iD I also talked to a Venmo assistant who agreed and said he sees my iD and I have to wait for a specialist to fix it. My thing is why aren‚Äôt I already talking to a specialist about my situation not a customer support person who barley has control over helping my situation. I callled not only did I wait and hear your wait music for almost 20 mins when they finally answered and helped me they told me I had to wait for the specialist! Y‚Äôall could‚Äôve told me that in a email after I receive my money I will be withdrawing and going back to cashapp because this is unacceptable. Have a nice day and keep safe from corona.

Let me in an unsafe situation, lost my job as a result Venmo doesn‚Äôt even deserve a star.  I recently got a Venmo debut card and the other day decided to make it my viable option to use for expenses and daily living.  On the first day August 2nd this card worked fine, as the second day approached I noticed the card decline at a gas station, I didn‚Äôt understand and had them run the card again.  Declined again.  I then called the number on the back of the card only to find out that you can not speak to a human on the weekends. You can only chat with a mobile agent at 7AM Pacific time.  So I had to sleep in my car as I was an hour away from home and had no other financial means.  I tried calling the number on the back of card but no one is available you can only activate it deactivate the card.  When I was able to chat with a mobile agent through text messaging they said sorry for inconvenience but there is nothing we can do.  I had $1000 plus in the account and was unable to get gas, they did not care about my welfare and did not has e a supervisor or anyone that could assist or was willing to assist.  As a result I could not get gas in my car and was unable to make it to work where there is a zero tolerance policy for tardiness.  I lost my job, my safety and peace of mind due to Venmo

Froze my account for no reason I recently got a Venmo account this month, and it was all going pretty smoothly for myself when I found out my account had been temporarily deactivated for some unknown reason. Keep in mind I only had my account for 9 days, but the day before my account was deactivated I transferred my Venmo balance to my bank because I had a feeling this would happen. I looked into the situation further and I saw people rarely got their accounts back... which results in Venmo holding your money for a total of 180 days! This is where you shouldn‚Äôt download their app when I tell you that Venmo‚Äôs TOS states that every transaction can be considered a violation and therefore be subject to being flagged. They can literally flag your account if they want to and they don‚Äôt have to a reason for it. Thus, holding your money waiting for you to verify with an ID... BOOM your account is locked with your money in it without anything you can do. If you don‚Äôt believe any of this google it your self. Venmo has a big history for deactivating accs with hundreds upon thousands of dollars being in held from users. All I want is my account back and to make sure my money is being transferred safe without having to worry about my account being terminated for no reason on your side.

DO YOUR RESEARCH ABOUT VENMO!! I sent $388 through Venmo to my mom and they froze both of our accounts asking for verification. We both uploaded our ID‚Äôs and were told it would take 3-5 business days to be reviewed by and account specialist. After the review period we were told our accounts were permanently revoked without any explanation. I didn‚Äôt mind that part at all honestly because the point of using Venmo is because I though it would be convenient and efficient and it was anything but that! Now this is the insane part. They did not volunteer any information about the $388 they had of my money. When I questioned them through email (that‚Äôs the only way of communicating with an account specialist), I was given a vague response about their investigation would take up to 180 day‚Äôs and the funds were a part of the investigation so they would let me know at the end of the 180 days if they could return any part of my money back to me!! Now after hearing this I went on BBB website for Venmo she literally every other complain is a story just like mine, some for thousands of dollars. I have no idea how Venmo is getting away with stealing people‚Äôs money but they are. There are many different apps like this so use one of them and stay away from Venmo at all costs!!

A Must Have in today‚Äôs Society With fast moving lives and technology only growing, it‚Äôs about time money catches up. Venmo makes it fun easy to send, receive, and request money from your friends and family. If you‚Äôre a secluded person or like some privacy then just make your transactions private so no one can see them. The only person that sees a private transaction is you and the person you are sending, requesting, or receiving money from.  Your received money is then stored in your own secure account until you decide to transfer it to your bank. My transfers usually take about and hour to a day. The more you use the app the better and faster it gets. If your 18 and can‚Äôt wait to transfer your money you can sign up for the Venmo card that connects to your Venmo secure account balance. That way you don‚Äôt have to wait. Those cards come in a variety of colors, so there is one for everyone. If you haven‚Äôt tried Venmo already I highly suggest you give it a go. You don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre missing out on.

Great Payment Platform... It‚Äôs been approximately 6 months since adding Venmo to a few similar money transferring formats I had already been using. I added Venmo as it is an alternative payment platform provided by PayPal. It provides users with an extremely easy P2P payment format. Venmo users have the opportunity to go well beyond just paying other people. They can signup to receive a Venmo MasterCard debit card that affords the freedom to purchase whatever from virtually wherever.  Regardless of purchasing in-store or online, as long as the retailer accepts MasterCard or even PayPal (Venmo being a PayPal subsidiary), it‚Äôs all good. Only downer, the balance held on a Venmo account MUST cover any transaction in its entirety as partial payments of transactions are not allowed. But I have a linked bank account that will always cover, so not enough of a biggie to warrant decreasing my rating or to provide anything less than my full recommendation for all those who haven‚Äôt already to start utilizing the awesome Venmo app by downloading it now!

Basically perfect I LOVE Venmo, my only complaint is that it can be annoying toggling between two different banks (one checking account with my bank where all my deposits go, the other is an online savings account where I put money aside to pay off loans and other bills). So if I‚Äôm using one account for every day payments, it‚Äôs a pain to  switch to the other account to take money from there. But honestly it‚Äôs not that big of a deal overall, especially when this app makes it so quick and easy (and secure) to pay people. I hate owing money, so being able to almost instantly pay someone back is amazing. And I REALLY hate fronting the money for something,  and there‚Äôs always the friend who is short right now but will get you back later...and you know you‚Äôll never see that money again. Not anymore, it‚Äôs insanely simple to pay someone (and to send payment requests to anyone who ‚Äúforgets‚Äù to pay you back right away). As Rihanna widely commanded, pay me what you owe me.

Venmo is the worst! In the beginning, Venmo worked really well for me. I was only using the app to receive payments from families that I babysit for. Super convenient. Over time, my boyfriend and I decided that we would use Venmo to save money for our trip to Orlando. On the day before the trip, my boyfriend transferred the money that we saved to my account so that I could deposit it. I tried to use the ‚ÄúInstant Transfer‚Äù option, but it wouldn‚Äôt allow me to so I called customer service. I spoke to a young woman who told me that there was some ‚Äúsuspicious activity‚Äù going on with my account. It was so frustrating because we weren‚Äôt able to get our money for another couple days. A few days after that incident, I received an email stating that my account was frozen and that I would need to send a photo of my I.D to them in order to get things straightened out. After sending the email, a lady named Vera R. (an account specialist with Venmo) responded to my email saying that my account is permanently deactivated! I was so confused and upset. Please do not waste your time with this app. It seems great and convenient in the beginning, but turns bad very quickly. Zelle is a great (and much safer) option for sending money to family and friends! :)

Was good-they Dont support joint accounts They were great. Until I was had to change my bank to my husbands because we‚Äôre married. I tried to add my bank account but it wouldn‚Äôt let me. Contacted Venmo again and they said that even though he deleted the bank, he still is linked to the account until he calls them himself to ‚Äúrelease‚Äù his account.. suspect. My husband is a marine so he isn‚Äôt home often. He was out in the field at the time so I had to wait til he was home. But when he gets off work, they‚Äôre customer service is closed. This has been so ridiculous. Does everyone else know that their bank account stays linked even after they delete it.. doesn‚Äôt seem very cool.

Debit Card and Support I received the debit card they offer to use your funds. I have tried it at multiple atms and online purchases. It has been declined every time and has shown a positive balance since I‚Äôve opened the account. I called the support number and the woman was very nice but said some users cards don‚Äôt always work for atm purchases and there is no reason for it and no way to correct it. I was also told the same thing with online purchases and how they may not work but that it should work in store. So I am now off to try the card for an I store purchase to see if it will work or be declined all ways around. When I asked for more information they said it‚Äôs what they are told and that they don‚Äôt know the reason and so on and so forth. I‚Äôve never heard of a company not letting there employees know how things work as well as someone who is partnered with MasterCard and owned by PayPal. If I were either company I‚Äôd be livid that people are given no solution and aren‚Äôt using their card which in I‚Äôm sure MasterCard is losing out everyday as I was told this happens to a lot of customers and no fix. Good luck Venmo. You might be new but how you can not know about the services and products you offer is mind blowing.

Good App The app is convenient for payments of the recipient only accepts Venmo. Each time I have signed in to make a payment though, I have to re-enter my bank info which is not so convenient. This is not the case with similar apps.

No better way than kneecapping your people Really, I never understood the functionality of this while also having PayPal. Worst Customer Service I‚Äôve Ever Experienced Hands-down the worst customer service I've ever experienced.  This is not how a company should treat their "valued" customers and I will be sure to use Venmo as the prime example of poor customer service in the many years to come.

Waste of time I‚Äôve have the biggest trouble trying to link any of my bank accounts or cards to my account to cash out. Use Zelle instead! So I had a friend who was sending me money for some work I did and I regret saying that I would try Venmo. (since I‚Äôm already a Zelle user)When sending money with Zelle the person receives it instantly and does not have to pay a percentage fee. I was willing to pay the 1% fee to receive my money instantly, however, I kept receiving an error message stating it couldn‚Äôt go through instantly. I called the Venmo customer service line and received absolutely no help from the person I spoke to. They said they didn‚Äôt know why I couldn‚Äôt use instant and stated that it would continue to do this for me, even in future transactions, and it wasn‚Äôt because my bank wasn‚Äôt a part of their instant program.  Upon researching online, I see I‚Äôm  not the only person who instant will not work for and who didn‚Äôt receive any help from Venmo customer service. I had to then select to wait 1-3 business day‚Äôs for it to go through, the app said it would go through the next day, but lo and behold tomorrow will be day 3 and I‚Äôve yet to get my money. Completely unsatisfied. If you want your money instantly... just use Zelle! Never had any issues receiving or sending money through them.

Safe and Convenient, but one thing... Venmo is just exactly what I need. I don‚Äôt carry cash, and the small business owners and services I support only take cash or sometimes don‚Äôt have card readers. I recently had a bad experience with a different cash application where $350 dollars was taken and I had to wait a few weeks for it to be refunded. Afterwards, my bank recommended that I discontinue use of that particular app.

Verify your account? More like verify someone else‚Äôs and lose your money! My boyfriend and I have been using Venmo for some time to pay each other for rent or other expenses we decide to split the cost of. Well, I recently sent my boyfriend $250 for this months rent, he transfers the money to his account (which happened successfully in the past) and never received his money. After a week he reaches out to them, and they claim they never verified his account. Now if they didn‚Äôt verify his account, where‚Äôd the money go? Well, it turns out they deposited the money into another persons account through the same banking agency with a similar last 4 digits of their account # (only found out after investigating with the bank since the online representatives continuously kept leaving our chat when trying to get to the bottom of this). Venmo claims they cannot do anything about getting the money back, even though they didn‚Äôt verify the account, and yet transferred the money successfully in the past AND are the ones that processed the payment to the strangers account even though it‚Äôs not the one that appears in my boyfriends Venmo account. Absolutely ridiculous, do NOT ever use Venmo!

Not reliable whatsoever. I REALLY thought this app would be reliable and convenient! It made it easy to pay my boyfriend back for groceries and my roommate for rent. Now, it takes DAYS for my money to get to my roommates‚Äô bank funds (no quick deposit available for him) and I can‚Äôt even quick transfer a measly $25 into my account from the app! When I called a representative she literally told me that for some unknown reason, the feature is no longer available to me. Even though it had been for months now! She told me she had no way of knowing or overriding the block on my account. Then what do they even have customer service for if they don‚Äôt know how to help customers? And this isn‚Äôt the first time it‚Äôs happened to me... from now on whatever money someone owes me, I‚Äôm just going to go straight to the bank and deposit it. That in itself takes away the use of this app- I mean if it actually worked properly, it‚Äôd be amazing! But that it does not. Furthermore, my mother had her funds of $400 just disappear once when transferring them to my brother‚Äôs account. If you don‚Äôt want your money to be mysteriously floating around and disappearing on an app, STAY AWAY from Venmo.

Too easy to scam I wish I could give this zero stars. Yesterday I attempted to send money to my brother. The app has access to my contacts so I searched for his name/number and send him money that way. It did not tell me that he didn‚Äôt have an account already. I get a notification that he accepted my referral and created an account then accepted my payment. My brother and I are chatting about it and he tells me he did not do that and when he tried to create an account later last night it said his number was already in use. So some random person now has my money and I assume by now has deleted the account as they no longer are responding to my comments or money requests (just for my initial payment amount.) Venmo support has been useless so far. I will be disputing this with my bank of course but beware to all users. This is the exact reason people fear this type of payment method, too easy to scam.

They took $285 from me DO NOT USE THIS APP This app doesn‚Äôt even deserve a star. I didn‚Äôt even want to download the app but my husband insisted because he uses it. This was actually my first time using it so I could pay a bill while he was away. Long story short my husband sent me $285 from his personal account, they instantly took it out but it wouldn‚Äôt transfer into my personal bank account through the app so I sent it back to my husband so he tried to send me a smaller amount. That didn‚Äôt work either so I sent it back. Next thing I know my husband and I received an email saying we violated their user agreement and our accounts are permanently deactivated and can no longer use Venmo. So I emailed them Sunday March 31st asking for a number to call so they can send the $285 back to my husbands personal account and their reply was their offices are closed so I can expect a reply during business hours Mon-Fri Mind you this all happened a WEEK AGO. No one has contacted me back and today is Tuesday. I don‚Äôt care about using their app I will never use it ever again; just send my husband‚Äôs money that you guys took! That‚Äôs the least you guys can do. Now we‚Äôre behind on our bill.

Horrible App This app was pretty easy to use, and I was able to send money easily. When it came to receiving money, I just wasn‚Äôt able to. I went through my bank app, and venmo had no problem taking money from my account, but I didn‚Äôt see any money being added to my account from venmo. All the times money was sent to me appeared in my venmo history, but somehow that money didn‚Äôt get to my actual bank account. Then I realized that VENMO had all of my money that had been sent to me. They obviously have my bank info because they are able to withdrawal money... I tried to log into my bank account (like I do almost every day) and it said my info was wrong and they threatened to lock my bank account. I‚Äôve had money sitting in this app for months and venmo didn‚Äôt bother to tell me and had me figure it out myself. What‚Äôs even worse is that they aren‚Äôt making it easy for me to get the money. They‚Äôre just waiving MY money over my head. I would delete this app, but it has over $200 in it, so that‚Äôs not an option. It would be great to get some answers, but the creators of this useless app are too busy sitting on thrones of cash to actually care about the people who use it.

Works great, until it doesn‚Äôt. Venmo has worked great for me for the last few years, until this year when they froze my account one day out of the blue. I never received any info about it being frozen in the first place, I figured it out when my roommate tried to pay me for our groceries and the payment didn‚Äôt go through. I emailed costumer support, and it took them 5 days to reply in which they told me I had ‚Äúviolated the terms of use‚Äù and they were to be terminating my account. I tried emailing them back asking for a simple  explanation of what I did wrong, but I‚Äôve yet to hear back from anyone and I doubt I will.

Will not use them again I did not use the account much, used to pay bills for my son.  Tried to set up an account for my son, so we each had one.  It let me change the user name and email.  Figured that my son was using it to pay bill and the contacts where all in the account.  Then make a new account so we each had one.  They would not let us do so.  Well after chatting with the a few times over a morning they said the new number was taken.  So we had to prove we had the cell phone.  I sent it over and had to check in with them a few times just to find out part of the info was missing.  When I screen shot it some how it was over looked.  Could they have not reached out to me and told me that.  Glad I was texting them for updates.  After all of that they said it would take 3-5 days to make sure the number was mine and they could release the number.  So now waiting for this to be completed they deactivated the one account that was working.  I am not going to wait and sit on hold again for what???  So we are now using a different app, that we set up with out problems in 25-30 minutes.  Don‚Äôt waist your time with this one.

Terrible app I‚Äôve been using Venmo for a good time now, and for the first couple of months it was a breeze to do transactions. However, my first problem was when someone accidentally sent me money, a complete random person, and I sent it back within a few hours. The person had already reported me for this, and all my Venmo balance from the past had been frozen. That isn‚Äôt the first problem. My second problem was their customer service, telling me that I couldn‚Äôt get my Venmo account unfrozen. Completely ridiculous. My third and final problem was before I even had my account frozen. I had been using my cc, and I tried to make a payment once. Kept declining so I called my card company. They said it was Venmo declining the transactions for security reasons, I reached out to customer service and they said they couldn‚Äôt help me. I removed my card, said it was allowed to be used on Venmo, but I already had been using this card before and made several transactions. I cancelled my card and got a new one, which I tried putting on Venmo but it wouldn‚Äôt work. This is a completely ridiculous app that only cares about themselves, and not their customers!!!!!!!

A JOKE masquerading as an app!!! I am not going to go on and on about the emotions I experienced when attempting to use Venmo.   The facts will hopefully be enough to keep you away!   I first downloaded Venmo to my laptop and it wasn‚Äôt until I had spoken with my second ‚Äúcustomer NO service‚Äù rep that I found that you cannot send money from your computer, only from the Venmo app.   And that‚Äôs only if you‚Äôre lucky!  My multiple attempts to send money were inexplicably ‚Äúblocked‚Äù by the system.  NO explanation from either of the reps.   Plenty of funds were and are available!  Both recipients ‚Äúfriends‚Äù are valid and in good standing in the their system.    The ‚Äúbest‚Äù resolution i was offer by the NO service rep was to wait a couple of days and try again.   Seriously!   Who would actually be insane enough to wait a couple of days and repeat my behavior in hope for a different result!   Get the point?   There is no customer service! DO NOT USE VENMO Venmo has no security or regard for people‚Äôs money or safety. They advertise it as an app to transfer money but they do not let it commonly known to people that it should not be used to pay people for goods/services unless you are a lawyer and read through 25 pages of legal documents. If you get paid through Venmo, then Venmo can reverse the transaction without your approval and not provide any protection. There is no way to file a claim against Venmo and they will reverse your transaction after you think it‚Äôs already in your account. They don‚Äôt care at all about their users. I know a lot of people who use Venmo to pay people without knowing that it technically violates their terms of use because most people do not read through 25 pages of user terms and since it is owned by PayPal it is very confusing to normal users since you can use PayPal to pay people. Very deceiving and unethical business practices. I recommend people stop using Venmo and letting their friends know that their money is not secure. Venmo does not verify accounts or payments at all, so you cannot trust that you will get your money. I emailed customer service and the CEO but they don‚Äôt care and don‚Äôt even respond.

Venmo Is Great for Musicians!!! As a musician and a band director, I'm always on the go, which means that sometimes I forget to bring my checkbook to a gig. Musicians should never be paid late. I‚Äôm going to quit the App This is recent but nearly every other time I go to use Venmo, I get the message that it‚Äôs has ‚Äúlost connection to my bank.‚Äù In order to fix it, I‚Äôm apparently not allowed to follow the link it offers me to ‚Äúupdate my account‚Äù oh no, if I do that, and go through the process and follow all the prompts it will then inform me that my ‚Äúbank is already on file.‚Äù So I‚Äôll have to remember that no, what I REALLY need to do is cancel the payment I‚Äôm trying to do, exit out and go the home screen and search through menus until I find where I can make it forget my bank account. Then I have to login again.

Venmo/paypal steals from customers As with any paypal-owned company, I kept zero to minmal balance in their hands. They froze my account a couple of times, demanding various sensitive personal identity or financial documents, to be delivered to them via plaintext (read; insecure) email. I refused and uploaded via https to their support site instead. That prevented them from seizing my funds until one day a friend sent over a three-figure amount for a plane ticket. Shortly thereafter, they froze my and my father‚Äôs accounts permanently, when 2 out of 10 small payments failed due to the VISA debit card refusing authorization. The ‚Äúaccount specialist‚Äù ‚Äúgustave‚Äù is a particularly nasty piece of work, always closing my tickets as ‚Äúresolved‚Äù after demanding a large number of ID and financial documents which obviously takes time to assemble but I eventually all provided. In the end, Venmo has permanently shut down my account without returning the three-figure balance I have. An internet search turns up thousands of similar horror stories, with people losing even more than what Venmo has stolen from me. Avoid it at all cost. Paypal/venmo personnel should be individually snd jointly prosecuted for their criminal enterprises.

Get Help? Venmo, all of a sudden, became like cable companies. When an issue arises, you sit with a bunch of well trained apologists that refuse to do anything but shift blame. Venmo skipped using my preferred payment method and used my company credit card, which was not marked as ‚Äúpreferred‚Äù in any way. The money was in the original account but somehow they couldn‚Äôt get it. Instead, they opted to use an inappropriate credit card without first requesting or mentioning it. Then they strong armed me because actually attacking the abuse of this problem would be a far worse abuse than I‚Äôve encountered this morning. Then their customer service reps, after not servicing their customer, acted as if they were taking the high road by not helping. Needless to say, they‚Äôve lost one customer, but nothing will actually happen until everyone is a bit more discerning with these huge corporations. I encourage everyone else to find another way to send money, possibly with a boutique version of Venmo, so they get the message that this version of ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù is an embarrassment to society and a huge embarrassment to the people employed in this work, and the distortion it must create of their perspectives.

What supposed to be an instant transfer...wasn‚Äôt! If there were ZERO starts I would give them that. My boyfriend transferred me $ through Vebmo by my request and I‚Äôm still regretting it. Horrible experience Horrible experience with my funds being stuck in  Venmo when instant transfer stopped working... only option is to give all banking info to do a standard transfer .. can‚Äôt use ANY card to receive transfers when this happens.! The very rude customer agent told me ‚Äúsend the money back where I got it‚Äù ( which wasn‚Äôt an option because it was for services rendered) or do a standard transfer (also not an option being that I‚Äôve had banking info compromised via PayPal & this is a PayPal platform) do my only option was to transfer my money to someone else to have them transfer it to me on cash ap (which I had to pay fees in both transfers) .. meanwhile all they can say is there is no supervisor available just try your instant transfer later and see if it works because they had no answer as to why it was not working. I will be deleting my Venmo and the ap and will no longer market or promote or use it as a payment option for myself or my businesses.

Don‚Äôt use will steal ur money!! I have been an avid user of Venmo for over three years now transferring min. Of a $1000 per month with this app. I recently transferred funds to a employee of mine, he had a new account and they wouldn‚Äôt let him transfer the funds for 3 days. So he got a little upset and they froze his account and I messaged the customer service trying to cancel the payment since Venmo refused to allow him access to the funds or unfreeze his account. They said I violated their user agreement and froze my account. After multiple calls, and emails they finally transferred the funds back to me on their app. But with my account frozen it has caused me enormous amount of money and time, with auto payments bouncing back and unable to make my monthly rent payment could potentially cause me to become homeless since that is the only form of payment my landlord takes. So I would highly recommend NOT using this app unless you want your money frozen and NEVER RETURNED!!! Still waiting for the $400 back since they still refuse to unfreeze my account simply for questioning why a payment was held. Don‚Äôt go to customer service or they will freeze ur account!! Beware!!!

Sometimes it‚Äôs fantastic other times üôÑ I have had money frozen or inexplicably disappear. I have recently had pieces of digital media (expensive Windows 10 apps) that are non-subscription based, after spending literally DAYS worth of real-world hours on them and going as far as paying for extra add-ons on said apps suddenly appear as ‚Äúdisputed purchases‚Äù literally multiple months after the fact inexplicably. I cannot recoup these funds, time, energy, nothing; not can I get an adequate explanation. Things like this are entirely unacceptable. Worst of all are some ‚Äúinstant transfers‚Äù that are inexplicably rejected for vague reasons. I end up having to send the money via Venmo for a fee (outrageous!) and have them take the cash out for me IF it isn‚Äôt ‚Äúfrozen‚Äù for some nonsensical reason of ‚Äúsuspicion.‚Äù It‚Äôs my money, you get your service fees, stop with the nonsense. You are literally screwing with people‚Äôs livelihood. There are MANY other services offering the same thing as Venmo where none of this happens. Sincerely, a beyond frustrated Venmo user.

Not for internationals: Worst money transfer app EVER I would give this app a negative rating if I could. I am not one to leave reviews. But my experience with Venmo has been so absolutely terrible that I want to warn further users. If you are an international student, Venmo can freeze your account and and money you have sitting there will become indefinitely inaccessible to you. Venmo supposedly froze my account with notice (I received none) when I tried to deposit my funds into my bank account. However,I had been able to send money to colleagues no problem. When I realized I could not deposit my money, I called Venmo and I was told my account had been frozen for some unknown reason and that I had to email to find out. I was eventually told I need to provide a US issued ID to prove my identity . Which I do not have , being Canadian. After multiple emails back and forth I was essentially told my money would remain inaccessible to me unless I provide the right kind of ID.. so unless I miraculously wake up with an American passport tomorrow, my money belongs to Venmo indefinitely. This is the most insidious and disgusting policy and treatment. Absolutely terrible.

STAY AWAY! Recently had the WORST experience ever, customer service department and compliance department and all those in between do NOT communicate internally and causes misinformation to the customer. After trying to send money to a friend for a girls trip to Cuba Venmo held my money up in their compliance department, I followed their processes to provide details but requested that after jumping through all those hoops that they just cancel the transaction once it met compliance requirements. They made me submit itinerary and other personal information to get the transaction out of the compliance department so it could be reversed. Jumped through all of these hoops and they just processed it anyway, against what we had disused (by that time I had just opted to use PayPal instead since it‚Äôs easier). Used to work there. Massive spam problems, security risk? Former Venmo employee. Couldn‚Äôt be more disappointed in how far down hill the app has gone. Sending money between PayPal and venmo I set Venmo up as a means to pay on my weekly board.  I did not want to have to set up a new app/account since I was already registered with PayPal. It was a 5 until... I made nearly a $1000 in multiple instant transfers yesterday from my Venmo account to my checking account. UNRELIABLE & CUSTOMER SERVICE HAS NO ANSWER TO MY QUESTIONS. I haven‚Äôt been able to add a debit card to my account for a few months now so I finally opted to adding a bank account. Won‚Äôt accept my Debit Card and it‚Äôs their fault but they don‚Äôt know why!? I entered all information correctly. Venmo app says info is wrong. I chat with a Venmo CSR and they give me a copy past answer 3 messages long basically saying either I entered the info wrong or it‚Äôs my banks fault.

Confusing foolish interface Venmo is ok to transfer $ if you can figure out its interface and get your list of people all loaded in.  Sending is easy but receiving seems convoluted. So easy I love the convenience. I have a group of friends and do workers that all use the app and seldom have to add more money or take it out. Money just circulates, without having to worry about losing cash. I have had 0 issues using the app to date.

Not a Secure App. Be careful! Very disappointed while using Venmo, some smart hacker made it possible to change my password and email address to the point that I wasn‚Äôt able to log in... Poor security systems I  do not understand how a company does not use their own security systems, especially with all the hacking going on. I‚Äôll make this as brief as possible. Never download this app/ everyone is disappointed This app is a scam! You can send money without a bank account can‚Äôt receive money. I‚Äôve had money on my account that I can‚Äôt use. Account Disabled with no Reason given, horrible customer service. I just recently downloaded the Venmo app to exchange money with my girlfriend. After my debit card wasn‚Äôt accepted for an unknown reason, I finally linked my personal bank account to my Venmo account.

Greedy! Too Buggy I have two main complaints, which led me to delete my app after two transactions - one failed.

Incredibly Intrusive This app is incredibly intrusive. It back-doors you into letting it view your contacts, then, without notice, it automatically ‚Äúfriends‚Äù EVERYONE in your contact list who is Venmo, sharing all your transactions as a default. You have to opt-out of having private transactions shared with everyone on your phone. The process to ‚Äúun-friend‚Äù everyone is difficult and time consuming. Syncing the app to your bank account is more difficult than most similar apps (Mint, PayPal, etc.). Once set up, the transactions are quick as easy. I have yet to be paid using Venmo, so I don‚Äôt know how easy or difficult it is to get the money from Venmo to your account. Overall, I am very surprised that this has become a popular money sharing app. PayPal is extensively better and gives me more confidence that my money/bank accounts are protected.

Frauds - Do not use this app My sister told me about this app. We were trying to book a vacation to the Bahamas for my birthday and could not use multiple cards to pay. So now I have to wait almost a week to receive my money back. IF I GET MY MONEY BACK... and no vacation!

Took my money and froze my account I have been using Venmo for a few years and had no problems. The worst!!! This app is so frustrating to use. It wouldn‚Äôt let me add my TD debit card to the account to transfer my funds. I contacted customer service and got a response 5 hours later. Be Aware They Are Not Protecting You...!!! If I could give this app a Zero...I Would. I sold a ticket for a concert to a guy who was recommended to me. Horrible app, horrible service!! If I had a chance to give this app minus 10, I would!! I have only used this app for 3 days and have had trouble all 3 days!!! My experience with ‚ÄòVenmo‚Äô and similar Apps I wish the ATM fee withdrawal fee wasn‚Äôt $5 each time! That adds up over time... wish there was a select few atm‚Äôs or banks that don‚Äôt charge that fee! ü§ï

Bad payment confirmation process Venmo asked for the last four digits of the telephone number of my intended recipient for my first payment. Didn‚Äôt match, so I checked my info, tried to get back to the page to correct, and Venmo sent the payment that I had set up to the wrong person without asking for confirmation or giving me the opportunity to correct. As a first time customer who is usually very computer literate, having used PayPal and Zelle, I find Venmo very unintuitive. And there is no recourse for correcting a mis-sent payment other than requesting the return. Is there opportunity for negative feedback on a user that refuses such a return? Also, I was expecting the opportunity to confirm with a telephone number my second payment recipient. This time the payment sent without the request for confirmation. I think I sent it to the correct recipient, but I had no means of confirmation before I sent it.

Horrible I wasn‚Äôt able to receive money from my friend and they didn‚Äôt want to give her back her money either. We basically both got robbed by Venmo. So basically they have the money just sitting there. I usually use cash app however this was the only way my friend could send me money as she doesn‚Äôt have cash app. I would not recommend this app to anyone. I wouldn‚Äôt even rate this app a 1 star however that‚Äôs the only to way to rate üôÑ. Horrible and I‚Äôm deactivating my account with them. As per Venmo apparently the only way to get ahold of someone higher in the company is through email and I have yet to hear anything back in regards to this matter; here we are almost two months later and no response.

Convenient for paying friends anywhere! I‚Äôve been using Venmo for a couple years now and it‚Äôs been consistently useful and convenient to use. It‚Äôs perfect for settling debts with other people or requesting payments for handmade/private items.

Took my money and froze my account. I recently opened a Venmo account to receive payment for a card I sold. Use anything but.... Venmo has given me sooooo much grief. It has left me in HORRIBLE situations and no matter if I call or if I used the chat feature to talk to staff, no one could help or even give me real information as to what was going on because ‚Äúsometimes the system just does things and we can‚Äôt override it‚Äù. Venmo ruined my kids‚Äô Christmas. Husband transferred money to me on Venmo. Needed the money TODAY, after today will be too late.  Keeps telling me ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt use this card on Venmo.‚Äù

Hard to load, easy to screw up payments There should absolutely be a ‚Äúconfirm? Yes / No‚Äù option after hittin pay or request because sometimes my fat fingers hit the wrong one and I end up paying $90 instead of requesting it so that person now owes me $180 and there‚Äôs nothing I can do about it. I just can't say enough good things I have had zero issues getting money or cashing out. I have been using this service for about 2 years. The most I have transferred was $1000 for a single payment. Rate Venmo Venmo is easy to set up. Also - I have never had any issues with the service . Plus . The cost doesn‚Äôt seem terrible . I should not forget they Even  offer other great stuff like connected to pay pal to buy on line and a Venmo card !! Impressed . will not help this app and service is a failure, it will ruin your day without letting you know that there was a problem to fix. $0.76 apparently was covered by venmo, no message or anything, and when i tried using it later, declined. DONT USE THIS APP I highly recommend sticking with Cashapp. I have NEVER encountered a problem with them. Why would anyone want this? I cannot connect my bank account to Venmo, despite trying a couple times. No technical help from them on that end either. I have to go through my debit card, which is ridiculous. Never had a problem like this on any other platform.

Missed the Mark I needed money sent from someone in a pinch and then have it transferred to my bank account. Having used Venmo before I thought it would be my safest bet. Logged in to my app, checked my notifications because there were some there and then proceeded to request funds from the person sending them. It was not till AFTER I received the payment and tried to initiate an instant transfer that I was notified that the feature is being worked on and that my money would be unavailable for 1-3 days even if I needed it now. No notification mentioned this issue. Someone in the company definitely dropped the ball to allow this to happen. I probably won‚Äôt be using this app again. Cash App is similar, the user interface is easier to navigate and picture this, I was able to get my money immediately following this situation using this other app.

Makes bills w roommates so easy! I started using Venmo to make paying bills with my roommates easier but it‚Äôs so useful for anything. If someone buys concert tickets or picks up the bill at a restaurant that doesn‚Äôt do split checks you can just pay your friend immediately. Just keep the 2 days in mind if you‚Äôre relying on a big deposit like rent from roommates.

DO NOT USE VENMO// TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE My friend tried to send me some money so I could order an Uber for him ( I was there with him when this happened ) and unfortunately right at the time he tried sending me the money there was a glitch in the app and his balance was deducted but no transaction was posted nor added to my balance. I said it‚Äôs okay we will just talk to a representative to help us out and get our money back but all they did was tell him to have me message them and when I messaged them all they did was tell me to have him message them?? They did absolute nothing to help us out and now he‚Äôs missing $7 from his account and aren‚Äôt doing much to help us get it back. Definitely just out for you‚Äôre money, USE APPLE PAY INSTEAD THESE PEOPLE DO NOT CARE ABOUT YOU OR YOUR MONEY.

No option for shared bank account I love venmo. It makes sending money fast and easy. However, my husband and I share a bank account. Because of this, we are not able to both have venmo accounts that transfer into the bank. I either have to have him send me money to pay someone or have him pay the person. It defeats the purpose of the app in some situations, and makes other situations awkward, since I have to tell people to wait while I contact my husband to pay them. This seems like it should be an easy thing to fix. When I am able to draw from my own bank account, I think it will be 5-star worthy.

Frozen account I tried adding my fraternity bank account to my profile and was denied. My account was frozen at that time and has remained frozen since then.  I am now nearing four months with my account frozen and still there is no end in sight. The things they are asking of me are things I can‚Äôt provide. Specifically a statement from the added account with my name which isn‚Äôt possible due to it being a non profit. I appreciate due diligence, especially with financials but after sending multiple statements, photo ID, and offering to even take a picture of my non profit debit card (which was something with my name) they cannot help me.
I hate this app Some of my clients use Venmo to pay me, but since I don‚Äôt have a bank account it is a nightmare to be able to actually use the money.

They hold you money hostage ! I‚Äôm a kayak tour guide. I get my electronic tips and base trip pay weekly via Venmo. After 4 weeks of no issues transferring my money instantly , today of all days , they will not execute an instant transfer. Same account , same card , no issues at the bank. Spoke with a csr on the phone and all she said was it was a hold on their end on the instant transfer and I would have to do a standard transfer which takes 1-3 days. I have bills to pay today, not 3 days from now . Holding my money where I can‚Äôt get it that I earned is not ok and I‚Äôm sure a lot if people will agree. I know the world has its crooks but the hardworking people who might have this happen need their money when they need it. If you are one of these people do not use this service . You might end up with fees from late bills as they hold your money as long as they seem fit.

Very disappointed Got this App for convenience, so I could send my daughter in NY money if needed.  So apparently I can receive payments but it will not allow me to send money?!?  How annoying! Would Give 0 Stars if Possible. On top of that, when I went to send him the money back, it took it straight out of my bank account, not my venmo balance. Now I‚Äôm at loss of $100+ dollars due to this and won‚Äôt be able to get my money back for weeks because I won‚Äôt be seeing him until then. Why bother to verify my bank account when I‚Äôm not going to be able to transfer money into it?? I wouldn‚Äôt have bothered with this app if I had known that, no one wants to use this app solely for sending others money and never receiving any. Will not be using again.

Victim of a Scam Use Zelle. I was a victim of a scam with Venmo, so there are weaknesses in their cyber security. When I told Venmo what had happened they put it under investigation but they were not helpful in trying to stop the fraudulent  charges. I went to my bank and they were able to freeze my account. A day later the charges hit my account, but since the account was frozen, the funds did not transfer. My Venmo account showed a negative balance for the charges. What is disturbing about the whole ordeal was that Venmo released the fund to the scammer, and when my bank did not transfer the my fund to Venmo, Venmo held ME responsible for the balance. Ridiculous. I am not sure what Venmo did as far as pursuing the scammers for the funds, but they will not allow me to use the app any more after this whole situation. That‚Äôs fine. I‚Äôm happy telling everyone I know to use Zelle instead. It‚Äôs instant and safer.

Does what it says but got weird fast I tried to send a payment to a friend last night but the app gives me this message that my payment is under review and could take up to 48 hours to complete. I hit ‚Äúcancel‚Äù and try again. Same deal. Only it turns out that the ‚Äúcancel‚Äù I tapped only got me out of the warning message and not out of the payment so I ended up paying him twice. Because it‚Äôs the weekend I get to wait several days to see my money back in my account. It is entirely too easy to double pay‚Äîseriously bad design. Also, why is there no way to cancel a payment and why was my payment flagged for review?!? Was it because I used the word ‚ÄúCuba‚Äù in the description? That‚Äôs the name of the restaurant we had dinner at. Can‚Äôt think of another possibility as I HAD plenty of money in my account. Very frustrated.

DO NOT DOWNLOAD I do not normally write reviews, in fact this is probably my first. This app doesn‚Äôt even deserve the one star I am forced to give. I sent $1,400 to my mechanic to pay for parts and labor to get my car fixed. Venmo sends me a email telling me I violated their terms and that my account has been frozen. If one thing was changed this would be the best So easy to give money to friends and family. I love it. But the ap is so awesome we endure that one really bad feature. And because it it so good other than that I‚Äôll  still give it 4 stars. Paying people made EASY Easy to set up, and works flawlessly. Very popular, so you can send money to almost anyone. Slow and buggy - Respond to your customers feedback I‚Äôm running on a iPhone XS and your app is very slow or buggy when it comes to entering names, entering in amounts and hitting the pay or request button. Not a 5 star yet VENMO !!! I have truly enjoyed having my VENMO card. It is definitely an asset as I use cards over cash most everyday. Not a 5 star card at this time. Horrible Customer Support I am beyond frustrated with Venmo. I haven‚Äôt ever wrote a review, on anything, in my entire life. I sent a payment to the wrong person on a Friday evening. Trash Trash TRASH This app is a fantastic idea but in application it is terrible. Absolutely ridiculous Would rate 0 stars if that was an option. Absolutely Terrible and they steal your money with no remorse After Venmo failed to link any of my debit cards that I know work because I previously linked them to Venmo the day before; I then tried to issue a bank transfer of $95 dollars which I thought was going to go through after 1-3 business days. Very helpful, very convenient I love Venmo! It is so convenient that this app does not require you to have the same bank as the person you are either requesting money from or sending money to! Worst app ever.... The last 4 out of 5 transfers were declined with no reason. When you call customer service their answers for why are scripted with no real help or accountability. Fraudulent charge Per venmos suggestion after I saw a charge I didn‚Äôt authorize on my online banking I filed a dispute with my bank and stopped payment. I contacted Venmo a second time and I still haven‚Äôt received an email or anything. Very poor customer service and my best suggestion is to not use Venmo.
NEVER DOWNLOAD THIS APP I‚Äôve made just two transactions through this app.

Trash My first time using Venmo and it is extremely inconvenient. Venmo immediately declines your attempted payments and transactions even though you have a Venmo balance. They offer zero assistance after waiting forever to speak or chat with someone. They literally tell you, just transfer your balance to your bank account, we have no idea why this ‚Äúsystematic error caused by Venmo is occurring and zero way to fix it.‚Äù Attempting a payment multiple times at different times yields the same error message that just states your payment is declined and that Venmo has no idea what caused it. Absolutely, Literally No Customer Service They got 2 stars Only for the reason that they‚Äôre system works ‚Äúsomewhat‚Äù.
